page.title: 06PINNACLE HOMES, WITHINGTON
page.content: {Pinnacle Homes}is based in Withington. They construct{Timber house frames}and they use Soft wood from Scandinavia and Unsorted Red woods from Canada. The company has a factory containing the latest machines of high precision cutting. Some machines shave corners or "mould" them, for instance a spindle mower, which travels along at 9000 revs. It is also used for making window frames. The workers wear protective clothing such as ear plugs, ear phones, goggles and face masks. All frames are nailed but first they are glued and held together. The process is mainly mechanised but staining and nailing are done by hand. They employ 63 men and 4 women and sell in the U.K. and export to Holland and Germany. The average wage is Â£100 per week.
